sentences.en: A figure having jointed parts animated from above by strings or wires; a marionette.
sentences.cn: 木偶由身体各部分相连接组成的用线或绳子操纵的形象; 牵线木偶.

sentences.en: He doubted if this could be found unless the operator can transpose himself into the centre of gravity of the marionette.
sentences.cn: 他怀疑这个路径是否会被发现，除非操作者能够把自身直入木偶的重心。

sentences.en: Ich schreibe die Musik, ich bin der Produzent , bin ich die Lichtgestalt , die diese Marionette dirigiert.
sentences.cn: 我创作音乐, 我是创造者,是控制这木偶的光中的形象.

sentences.en: Marionette Puppet Toy ( lion ) is controled by real people.
sentences.cn: 本人供应木偶玩具 ( 提线狮子 ) 等.

sentences.en: Marionette: Puppet figure manipulated from above by strings attached to a wooden cross or control.
sentences.cn: 提线木偶: 从上空提线操纵或藉缚在控制器上的细线而操纵的木偶形体.

sentences.en: The development of marionette had a great influence on the future development of opera.
sentences.cn: 木偶戏的发展对以后的戏曲有十分重要的影响.

sentences.en: The illustration that I use a lot is that we view life like a little marionette puppet, where you have these strings that run down to it, and we think that we are the puppet-master of our life.
sentences.cn: 我经常应用的这种错觉就是我们把生活看成是一个牵线木偶，有一些线绳牵制着它，我们以为我们是这个木偶的操控者。

sentences.en: Then slowly slide down the wall, falling forward from the waist—like a marionette with slack strings.
sentences.cn: 然后缓慢顺墙滑身而下，而腰部向前落——就像是松紧线牵动的木偶。

trans.tran_en: a  puppet  whose arms and legs are moved by pulling strings
